title: Cicadas: The US chef cooking up the insect 'flavour bombs'
description: Billions of cicadas have emerged in the US and Brooklyn cook Joseph Yoon is making good use of them.

title: County lines: The search for vulnerable children
description: The BBC's Angus Crawford joins police as they look for vulnerable young people involved in county lines.

title: The teenagers fighting India's deadly Covid crisis
description: Suhani and Prabhpreet are part of a team who find and verify what resources are available for families in need.

title: Canary Islands: 'Taking in migrants changed my life'
description: A British businessman has turned his Canary Islands hotel into a home for migrants from Africa.

title: Brighton artist turns coma hallucinations into graphic novel
description: Zara Slattery had vivid hallucinations during a medical coma while fighting a flesh-eating bug.

title: Angry, upset, relieved - Covid bereaved families on Cummings claims
description: After Dominic Cummings' testimony on Wednesday, some bereaved by the pandemic are asking: what if?

title: Does the UK have highest Covid death toll in Europe?
description: The total is the largest but for deaths per 100,000 people the UK is no longer top.

title: Tottenham make contact with former boss Pochettino
description: Tottenham contact Mauricio Pochettino, who managed Spurs from 2014 to 2019, about a return to the club.

title: Arlene Foster awarded £125k damages in Dr Christian Jessen libel case
description: A judge rules an unfounded tweet by Dr Christian Jessen about an alleged extra-marital affair was "outrageous".

title: Covid: Too early to say if England's lockdown can lift on 21 June - Hancock
description: The health secretary says he "desperately" wants rules to ease on 21 June but will only do so if safe.

title: Covid vaccines and rare clots - what you need to know
description: We take a look at why these unusual clots happen and when they occur.

title: Zidane leaves Real Madrid for second time
description: Zinedine Zidane resigns as Real Madrid manager after their first season without a trophy since 2010.

title: Covid: We've always been straight with people - Matt Hancock
description: The health secretary rejects Dominic Cummings' accusation that he lied about his Covid handling.

title: Fred West: No human remains found in Mary Bastholm search
description: Gloucestershire Police has been searching a cafe cellar for suspected victim Mary Bastholm.

title: India YouTuber arrested for 'flying' dog with helium balloons
description: He tied helium balloons to his dog and attempted to "fly" the pet to make a viral video.

title: Super 'blood' Moon treats stargazers around the world
description: Two rare celestial events have coincided as the Moon appears larger during a lunar eclipse.

title: Archer ready to 'sit out summer' to be fit for T20 World Cup and Ashes
description: Fast bowler Jofra Archer is ready to "sit out the summer" in order to be fit for the Twenty20 World Cup and Ashes later this year.

title: George Floyd: Should we stop sharing videos of black trauma?
description: A video of George Floyd's last moments was watched and shared by millions.

title: Covid: Biden orders investigation into virus origin as lab leak theory debated
description: US intelligence is divided on whether the virus came from a Chinese lab or animal-to-human contact.

title: Houghton, Weir and Ingle in GB squad for Olympics
description: England captain Steph Houghton is among those selected for the Team GB squad at this summer's Olympic Games.

title: School of Rock drummer Kevin Clark dies, aged 32
description: Jack Black and Miranda Cosgrove lead tributes to the musician, who was killed in a traffic accident.

title: Belarus: I'm ready to beg for help, says mother of detained woman
description: The mother of Sofia Sapega, who was arrested when her flight was grounded in Minsk, speaks to the BBC.

title: Wizards' Westbrook wants action after popcorn incident with fan
description: The Washington Wizards guard Russell Westbrook had to be restrained by security after a fan poured popcorn over him in his side's 120-95 defeat at the Philadelphia 76ers.

title: Friends reunion: 10 of the best moments
description: The six stars have reunited for a new televised special, 17 years after Friends drew to a close.

title: North Yorkshire Police find nine people in uninsured car
description: Two female passengers crawled out of the boot during the traffic stop in North Yorkshire.

title: Friends reunion: The references that stood the test of time
description: The Friends reunion is out - here are the parts of the show that are still spoken about today.

title: 'I pictured my son's drowning on my charity swim'
description: A woman, whose son drowned on holiday, tells how the open water challenge stirred up panic attacks and flashbacks.

title: 'There's a sense black people are being paid less'
description: It's a year since businesses made racial diversity pledges following George Floyd’s death - so what has changed?

title: RTHK: How authorities cracked down on Hong Kong's only public broadcaster
description: New changes in RTHK have signalled that its fate as an independent public service may be under threat.
